Investigation: Examination of ears, throat, and temperature
Justification: To assess the severity of the ear infection and rule out other possible causes of the fever.
To visualize the eardrum and look for signs of inflammation or infection.
To assess the function of the middle ear and identify any fluid buildup.
To check for signs of infection, such as an elevated white blood cell count.
To rule out a urinary tract infection, which can sometimes cause fever and ear pain.
